# MiciMike drop-in PCB replacement for Google Nest Mini [MiciMike Nest Mini](https://github.com/iMike78/nest-mini-drop-in-pcb) is a drop-in PCB replacement for the ["Google Nest Mini" (Google's second-generation smart speaker with a barrel connector charging port)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Nest_(smart_speakers)), but based on ESP32 and XMOS microcontrollers for running open-source firmware. Tip! If you are instead looking for a similar drop-in PCB replacement for the "Google Home Mini" (Google's first-generation smart speaker hardware with a Micro-USB charging port) then check out the sister-project at https://github.com/iMike78/home-mini-v1-drop-in-pcb

# Remplacement PCB drop-in MiciMike pour Google Nest Mini [MiciMike Nest Mini](https://github.com/iMike78/nest-mini-drop-in-pcb) est un remplacement de PCB drop-in pour le ["Google Nest Mini" (l‚Äôenceinte intelligente de deuxi√®me g√©n√©ration de Google avec port de charge √† connecteur cylindrique)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Nest_(smart_speakers)), mais bas√© sur les microcontr√¥leurs ESP32 et XMOS pour ex√©cuter un firmware open-source. Astuce ! Si vous recherchez plut√¥t un remplacement de PCB drop-in similaire pour le "Google Home Mini" (la premi√®re g√©n√©ration de l‚Äôenceinte intelligente de Google avec port de charge Micro-USB), consultez le projet fr√®re sur https://github.com/iMike78/home-mini-v1-drop-in-pcb

RowTranslations.originContent: # MiciMike drop-in PCB replacement for Google Nest Mini
RowTranslations.translatedContent: # Remplacement PCB drop-in MiciMike pour Google Nest Mini

RowTranslations.originContent: [MiciMike Nest Mini](https://github.com/iMike78/nest-mini-drop-in-pcb) is a drop-in PCB replacement for the ["Google Nest Mini" (Google's second-generation smart speaker with a barrel connector charging port)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Nest_(smart_speakers)), but based on ESP32 and XMOS microcontrollers for running open-source firmware.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: [MiciMike Nest Mini](https://github.com/iMike78/nest-mini-drop-in-pcb) est un remplacement de PCB drop-in pour le ["Google Nest Mini" (l‚Äôenceinte intelligente de deuxi√®me g√©n√©ration de Google avec port de charge √† connecteur cylindrique)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Nest_(smart_speakers)), mais bas√© sur les microcontr√¥leurs ESP32 et XMOS pour ex√©cuter un firmware open-source.

RowTranslations.originContent: Tip! If you are instead looking for a similar drop-in PCB replacement for the "Google Home Mini" (Google's first-generation smart speaker hardware with a Micro-USB charging port) then check out the sister-project at https://github.com/iMike78/home-mini-v1-drop-in-pcb

Si vous recherchez plut√¥t un remplacement de PCB drop-in similaire pour le "Google Home Mini" (la premi√®re g√©n√©ration de l‚Äôenceinte intelligente de Google avec port de charge Micro-USB), consultez le projet fr√®re sur https://github.com/iMike78/home-mini-v1-drop-in-pcb

Content: Both of these are fully open-source hardware projects, taking some concep inspiration from the [Onju Voice](https://github.com/justLV/onju-voice) however aiming to follow [Open Home Foundation's open voice assistants standard with Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition as reference](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) for PCB designs and specifications. # Project scope The goal of this project and repository (which is similar to the [Onju Voice](https://github.com/justLV/onju-voice) but under a fully open-source hardware license) is to design a drop-in replacement PCB (Printed Circuit Board) with hardware schematics that anyone can make/build or order from a one-stop PCB manufacturer as a custom drop-in replacement PCB for the Google Nest Mini (2nd Gen). This is primarly targeting people looking to convert/repurpose their old Google Nest Mini smart speakers into open-source hardware for [Voice Control of Home Assistant](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/) and/or media player speaker output for [Music Assistant](https://www.music-assistant.io), (the hardware can however probably also be used with other applications as well with other firmware as it is based on the popular Espressif ESP32 platform). The hardware design will (similar to [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/)) integrate an ESP32-S3 SoC for WiFi, BLE, and [onboard wake-word detection](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/about_wake_word/) (using no-code [ESPHome firmware](https://esphome.io/)) + an XMOS xCORE XU316 chip for advanced audio processing (with custom firmware for microphone cleanup offloading for better voice recognition capabilities by using using locally running algorithms for Noise Suppression, Acoustic Echo Cancellation, Interference Cancellation, and Automatic Gain Control). Functionality-wise it is made to mostly hardware comatible with the [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition (a.k.a. Home Assistant Voice PE](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) reference design (which has been released as open-source hardware design from Open Home Foundation in coolaboration with Nabu Casa). The main difference will be due to constraints defined by the Google Nest Mini enclosure and comonents, (i.e. the nest-mini-drop-in-pcb project hardware design will be limited by the same type of physical capacity inputs as the original hardware from Google). As such the scope of this project/repository is not to develop new features/functions for the ESPHome firmware, so if you want that then you instead need to turn to the firmware development of the Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition as well as to the upstream ESPHome mainline code: - https://github.com/esphome/home-assistant-voice-pe - https://github.com/esphome/esphome - https://github.com/esphome/feature-requests ## Request for collaboration If you have some experience with PCB layout design, (and epecially with PCB routing, ground pouring, or noise-sensitive digital+analog layouts), **your help is highly appreciated**! Please feel free to open a new issue, submit suggestions/requests, and add input/feedback to existing issues, or fork this repository. For more information about the concept/idea see and contribute to related discussion also see this Home Assistant community forum thread: - https://community.home-assistant.io/t/any-news-on-alternative-to-onju-voice-pcb-repacement-design-for-google-nest-home-mini-speakers-with-added-xmos-chip-to-match-official-home-assistant-voice-preview-edition-reference-hardware/860001/ ### Current status - ‚úÖ Schematic completed - ‚úÖ Component placement done - ‚úÖ Routing is done - ‚úÖ Ground pour, shielding strategy, and EMI considerations done - ‚ö†Ô∏è 1st test batch failed on two errors - fixed - üïì waiting for the 2nd test batch
Translation: Les deux sont des projets de mat√©riel enti√®rement open-source, s‚Äôinspirant du concept de [Onju Voice](https://github.com/justLV/onju-voice) mais visant √† suivre la [norme des assistants vocaux open-source de l‚ÄôOpen Home Foundation avec Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition comme r√©f√©rence](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) pour la conception et les sp√©cifications des PCB. # Port√©e du projet L‚Äôobjectif de ce projet et de ce d√©p√¥t (similaire √† [Onju Voice](https://github.com/justLV/onju-voice) mais sous une licence mat√©rielle enti√®rement open-source) est de concevoir un PCB de remplacement (carte de circuit imprim√©) avec des sch√©mas mat√©riels que chacun peut fabriquer/construire ou commander aupr√®s d‚Äôun fabricant de PCB en tant que pi√®ce de remplacement personnalis√©e pour le Google Nest Mini (2e g√©n√©ration). Ce projet cible principalement les personnes souhaitant convertir/r√©utiliser leurs anciens haut-parleurs intelligents Google Nest Mini en mat√©riel open-source pour le [contr√¥le vocal de Home Assistant](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/) et/ou comme sortie haut-parleur lecteur multim√©dia pour [Music Assistant](https://www.music-assistant.io), (le mat√©riel peut cependant probablement √™tre utilis√© avec d‚Äôautres applications avec un firmware diff√©rent car il est bas√© sur la populaire plateforme Espressif ESP32). La conception mat√©rielle int√©grera (similaire √† la [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/)) un SoC ESP32-S3 pour le WiFi, BLE et la [d√©tection embarqu√©e du mot de r√©veil](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/about_wake_word/) (avec le firmware sans code [ESPHome](https://esphome.io/)) + une puce XMOS xCORE XU316 pour le traitement audio avanc√© (avec un firmware personnalis√© pour le nettoyage du microphone afin d‚Äôam√©liorer la reconnaissance vocale en utilisant des algorithmes locaux pour la suppression de bruit, l‚Äôannulation d‚Äô√©cho acoustique, l‚Äôannulation d‚Äôinterf√©rences et le contr√¥le automatique du gain). En termes de fonctionnalit√©, il est con√ßu pour √™tre principalement compatible mat√©riellement avec la [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition (alias Home Assistant Voice PE)](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) (qui a √©t√© publi√©e comme conception mat√©rielle open-source par l‚ÄôOpen Home Foundation en collaboration avec Nabu Casa). La principale diff√©rence proviendra des contraintes d√©finies par le bo√Ætier et les composants du Google Nest Mini, (c‚Äôest-√†-dire que la conception mat√©rielle du projet nest-mini-drop-in-pcb sera limit√©e par les m√™mes types d‚Äôentr√©es physiques de capacit√© que le mat√©riel original de Google). Ainsi, la port√©e de ce projet/d√©p√¥t n‚Äôest pas de d√©velopper de nouvelles fonctionnalit√©s pour le firmware ESPHome ; si vous souhaitez cela, il faut vous tourner vers le d√©veloppement du firmware de la Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition ainsi que vers le code principal amont d‚ÄôESPHome : - https://github.com/esphome/home-assistant-voice-pe - https://github.com/esphome/esphome - https://github.com/esphome/feature-requests ## Demande de collaboration Si vous avez de l‚Äôexp√©rience dans la conception de PCB, (et en particulier en routage de PCB, plan de masse, ou conception de circuits num√©riques+analogiques sensibles au bruit), **votre aide est grandement appr√©ci√©e** ! N‚Äôh√©sitez pas √† ouvrir une nouvelle issue, soumettre des suggestions/demandes, ajouter vos remarques/retours aux issues existantes, ou √† forker ce d√©p√¥t. Pour plus d‚Äôinformations sur le concept/id√©e, consultez et contribuez √©galement √† la discussion li√©e sur ce fil du forum Home Assistant : - https://community.home-assistant.io/t/any-news-on-alternative-to-onju-voice-pcb-repacement-design-for-google-nest-home-mini-speakers-with-added-xmos-chip-to-match-official-home-assistant-voice-preview-edition-reference-hardware/860001/ ### √âtat actuel - ‚úÖ Sch√©ma termin√© - ‚úÖ Placement des composants effectu√© - ‚úÖ Routage termin√© - ‚úÖ Plan de masse, strat√©gie de blindage et consid√©rations EMI termin√©es - ‚ö†Ô∏è 1√®re s√©rie de tests √©chou√©e √† cause de deux erreurs - corrig√©es - üïì en attente de la 2√®me s√©rie de tests

Content:
## Tools used

- üõ†Ô∏è KiCad 9
- üß∞ SnapEDA / LCSC for footprint sourcing

## Known hardware specifications

- 4-layer PCB
- ESP32-S3R8 bare chip (ESP32-S3 for WiFi, BLE, and onboard wake-word detection)
- XMOS XU316-1024-QF60B-C24 (XMOS XU316 xCORE DSP audio processing)
- Dual SPI flash (as ESP32 and XMOS have their own SPI flash)
- Dual I¬≤S buses (to allow I2S interfaces at the same time, i.e. simultaneous audio output and audio input)
- MAX98357 for speaker output (I2S Class-D Mono Audio Amplifyer)
- 2x MEMS microphones (dual MMICT390200012 with 68mm inter-mic spacing)
- 6x SK6812 RGB LEDs
- Custom USB-C and 14V power input (Note! USB-C and barrel-connector can not be connected at the same time)

---

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Flashing via USB-C requires disconnecting the main 14V power input. See silkscreen note on PCB for details.

## References

### Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition resources including PCB design files
- https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/
  - https://voice-pe.home-assistant.io/resources/
    - https://support.nabucasa.com/hc/en-us/articles/26195279589277-Home-Assistant-Voice-Preview-Edition-PCB-design-files
      - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/NabuCasa/support/refs/heads/main/static/docs/voice/home_assistant_voice_pe_schematic_v1.0_241009.pdf
     
#### ESPHome firmware for Home Assistant Voice PE (which also use the same ESP32-S3 + XMOS XU316 combination):

- https://github.com/esphome/home-assistant-voice-pe
  - https://esphome.github.io/home-assistant-voice-pe/
- https://voice-pe.home-assistant.io/

### XMOS xCORE DSP (XU316-1024-QF60B-C32) MCU IC chip

- https://www.xmos.com/download/XU316-1024-QF60B-xcore.ai-Datasheet(3).pdf
- https://www.xmos.com/software-tools/
  - https://www.xmos.com/develop/xcore-voice
Translation:
## Outils utilis√©s

- üõ†Ô∏è KiCad 9
- üß∞ SnapEDA / LCSC pour la recherche d'empreintes

## Sp√©cifications mat√©rielles connues

- PCB √† 4 couches
- Puce nue ESP32-S3R8 (ESP32-S3 pour WiFi, BLE et d√©tection de mot-cl√© embarqu√©e)
- XMOS XU316-1024-QF60B-C24 (Traitement audio DSP XMOS XU316 xCORE)
- Double m√©moire flash SPI (car ESP32 et XMOS ont leur propre flash SPI)
- Doubles bus I¬≤S (pour permettre des interfaces I2S en simultan√©, c‚Äôest-√†-dire sortie et entr√©e audio simultan√©es)
- MAX98357 pour la sortie haut-parleur (Amplificateur audio mono Classe-D I2S)
- 2x microphones MEMS (double MMICT390200012 avec un espacement inter-microphones de 68mm)
- 6x LED RGB SK6812
- USB-C personnalis√© et entr√©e alimentation 14V (Remarque ! USB-C et connecteur d‚Äôalimentation ne peuvent pas √™tre connect√©s en m√™me temps)

---

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Le flashage via USB-C n√©cessite de d√©connecter l'entr√©e principale 14V. Voir la note s√©rigraphi√©e sur le PCB pour plus de d√©tails.

## R√©f√©rences

### Ressources Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition y compris fichiers de conception PCB
- https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/
  - https://voice-pe.home-assistant.io/resources/
    - https://support.nabucasa.com/hc/en-us/articles/26195279589277-Home-Assistant-Voice-Preview-Edition-PCB-design-files
      - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/NabuCasa/support/refs/heads/main/static/docs/voice/home_assistant_voice_pe_schematic_v1.0_241009.pdf
     
#### Micrologiciel ESPHome pour Home Assistant Voice PE (qui utilise aussi la m√™me combinaison ESP32-S3 + XMOS XU316) :

- https://github.com/esphome/home-assistant-voice-pe
  - https://esphome.github.io/home-assistant-voice-pe/
- https://voice-pe.home-assistant.io/

### XMOS xCORE DSP (XU316-1024-QF60B-C32) puce IC MCU

- https://www.xmos.com/download/XU316-1024-QF60B-xcore.ai-Datasheet(3).pdf
- https://www.xmos.com/software-tools/
  - https://www.xmos.com/develop/xcore-voice

RowTranslations.translatedContent: - üß∞ SnapEDA / LCSC pour la recherche d'empreintes

RowTranslations.originContent: - ESP32-S3R8 bare chip (ESP32-S3 for WiFi, BLE, and onboard wake-word detection)
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - Puce nue ESP32-S3R8 (ESP32-S3 pour WiFi, BLE et d√©tection de mot-cl√© embarqu√©e)

RowTranslations.originContent: - XMOS XU316-1024-QF60B-C24 (XMOS XU316 xCORE DSP audio processing)
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - XMOS XU316-1024-QF60B-C24 (Traitement audio DSP XMOS XU316 xCORE)

RowTranslations.originContent: - Dual SPI flash (as ESP32 and XMOS have their own SPI flash)
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - Double m√©moire flash SPI (car ESP32 et XMOS ont leur propre flash SPI)

RowTranslations.originContent: - Dual I¬≤S buses (to allow I2S interfaces at the same time, i.e. simultaneous audio output and audio input)

RowTranslations.originContent: - MAX98357 for speaker output (I2S Class-D Mono Audio Amplifyer)

RowTranslations.originContent: - 2x MEMS microphones (dual MMICT390200012 with 68mm inter-mic spacing)
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - 2x microphones MEMS (double MMICT390200012 avec un espacement inter-microphones de 68mm)

RowTranslations.originContent: - Custom USB-C and 14V power input (Note! USB-C and barrel-connector can not be connected at the same time)
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - USB-C personnalis√© et entr√©e alimentation 14V (Remarque ! USB-C et connecteur d‚Äôalimentation ne peuvent pas √™tre connect√©s en m√™me temps)
